content:
• Friday, October 26, 2012
  • DWRE

    Demandware (DWRE -5.9%) sold off today. One possible reason: NetSuite (N +15%) noted on its Q3...

    Demandware (DWRE -5.9%) sold off today. One possible reason: NetSuite (N +15%) noted on its Q3 earnings call its SuiteCommerce platform, which competes with Demandware's e-commerce software solutions, is successfully moving upmarket, and was adopted by "a couple multi-billion dollar retailers" during Q3.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:55 PM
  • S

    Clearwire (CLWR +5.6%) finished the day with a decent gain after announcing it plans to delay...

    Clearwire (CLWR +5.6%) finished the day with a decent gain after announcing it plans to delay some 4G investments, and is sharply lowering its 2012 capex forecast as a result. The fact Sprint's (S -0.2%) own 4G buildout is facing delays likely influenced Clearwire's plans. During its earnings call, Clearwire claimed it has enough cash for another 12 months, while stressing Sprint doesn't gain "any additional governance rights" as a result of now having a 50%+ stake.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM
  • QTM-OLD

    In a sign the Street is on edge over enterprise storage demand, Quantum (QTM-OLD -9%) and...

    In a sign the Street is on edge over enterprise storage demand, Quantum (QTM-OLD -9%) and Fusion-io (FIO -4.5%) sold off again today following disappointing earnings reports (I, II). In Quantum's case, the company's decision to issue $60M in convertible notes (they sport a 4.5% yield and $1.65/share conversion price) also isn't going over well. Many peers posted modest declines, though depressed QLogic and Emulex bounced following their earnings reports. (EMC guidance)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM
  • MSI

    Motorola Solutions (MSI +3.2%) closes higher after reaching a deal with activist investor...

    Motorola Solutions (MSI +3.2%) closes higher after reaching a deal with activist investor ValueAct Capital. ValueAct partner Bradley Singer has been added to Motorola's board, and so has ConEd CEO Anne Pramaggiore. In return, ValueAct has promised to keep its stake in Motorola in a range between 7.5%-12.5% until the company's 2014 shareholder meeting, and not to wage a proxy fight. (Q3 results)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM
  • KEX

    Tank-barge operator Kirby Corp. (KEX +5.5%) will replace bulk shipper Overseas Shipholding Group...

    Tank-barge operator Kirby Corp. (KEX +5.5%) will replace bulk shipper Overseas Shipholding Group (OSG -5.4%) in the Dow Jones Transportation Average after the close of trading on Monday. The index change is being done because OSG announced earlier this week it is evaluating strategic options, including a potential Chapter 11 and certain previously issued financial statements shouldn't be relied on.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM
  • PBR

    Petrobras (PBR +0.9%) is backing out of a multibillion-dollar project to build an ethanol...

    Petrobras (PBR +0.9%) is backing out of a multibillion-dollar project to build an ethanol pipeline in southeastern Brazil, according to Cosan (CZZ +2.8%), one of the six companies investing in the pipeline. PBR, like CZZ's biofuels JV Raizen, has a 20% stake in Logum Logistica, the company formed last year to build and operate the pipeline and ethanol storage facilities.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • JCP

    A defense from Citigroup helps J.C. Penney (JCP +1.3%) return back to positive territory for the...

    A defense from Citigroup helps J.C. Penney (JCP +1.3%) return back to positive territory for the day. Research cited by the firm suggests consumers are responding positively to J.C. Penney's new product assortment. Look for the retailer's Q3 report to give a little bit more visibility on that issue after the last two quarterly reports were far from uneventful.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:52 PM | 3 Comments
  • COG

    Cabot Oil & Gas (COG +9.8%) is up nearly 10% after last night's strong Q3 earnings...

    Cabot Oil & Gas (COG +9.8%) is up nearly 10% after last night's strong Q3 earnings report and encouraging commentary on Q4 and 2013. Stifel Nicolaus points out that COG stated it now has ~90% of its 2012 gathering permits in hand and 30 Marcellus wells will be placed in production in Q4, which should result in solid growth and exit rates.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:43 PM
  • JNP

    Specialty pharmaceutical company Columbia Laboratories (CBRX -41%) gets clobbered today after...

    Specialty pharmaceutical company Columbia Laboratories (CBRX -41%) gets clobbered today after the FDA denies Watson Pharmaceuticals (WPI -0.5%) formal dispute-resolution request related to its new-drug application for Prochieve, a treatment for the prevention of preterm birth. Watson said it intends to review possible options to continue pursuit of the the drug's development.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM
  • NS

    NuStar Energy (NS -2.3%) dips on a downgrade to Underperform at Credit Suisse today, citing...

    NuStar Energy (NS -2.3%) dips on a downgrade to Underperform at Credit Suisse today, citing deterioration in its asphalt and fuels marketing businesses and concerns over distribution coverage. The firm also slashed its price target to $44 from $64.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:22 PM | 2 Comments
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NFLX +13.2%) continues to drive higher fueled by renewed rumors Microsoft is in the...

    Netflix (NFLX +13.2%) continues to drive higher fueled by renewed rumors Microsoft is in the hunt for the company. A quick exit now and an investor is back to where they were before the company's Q3 earnings bomb (I, II, III).
     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 PM | 9 Comments
  • SLS

    Galena Biopharma GALE +5.4%) moves up after releasing positive data from its phase 1/2 clinical...

    Galena Biopharma GALE +5.4%) moves up after releasing positive data from its phase 1/2 clinical trial of tumor drug NeuVax. According to the trial, the drug showed a consistent reduction of circulating tumor cells in vaccinated patients. Final results will be reported at the San Antonio Breast Cancer Symposia in December 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:03 PM
  • WLB

    Westmoreland Coal (WLB +5.2%) is upgraded to Outperform with a new target price of $13 from $7...

    Westmoreland Coal (WLB +5.2%) is upgraded to Outperform with a new target price of $13 from $7 at Imperial Capital based on higher expected Ebitda on cost reduction, execution of its Kemmerer acquisition and free cash flow yield. WLB's Q3 results released yesterday showed significantly improved coal segment results.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:51 PM
  • ELX

    Storage adapter card/switch vendors Emulex (ELX +9.7%) and QLogic (QLGC +6.3%) have trekked...

    Storage adapter card/switch vendors Emulex (ELX +9.7%) and QLogic (QLGC +6.3%) have trekked higher after posting their calendar Q3 reports (I, II). Both companies had fallen sharply due to weak enterprise server demand. Emulex guided for FQ2 revenue of $120M-$124M and EPS of $0.19-$0.21, largely below a consensus of $129.1M and $0.21. QLogic guided for FQ3 revenue of $112M-$118M and EPS of $0.14-$0.19, below a consensus of $126.8M and $0.23. Rival Mellanox (MLNX +1.2%) is up slightly. (ELX transcript) (QLGC transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:41 PM
  • AMD

    AMD (AMD -2.6%) sells off after Fitch downgrades its rating on the chipmaker's senior notes to B...

    AMD (AMD -2.6%) sells off after Fitch downgrades its rating on the chipmaker's senior notes to B from B+, and revises its outlook to Negative. The ratings agency warns AMD's cash balance (currently $1.5B) could fall below its stated optimal level of $1.1B due to ongoing losses. It's also worried about ARM-based competition and pending R&D job cuts, and thinks gross margin will remain in the mid-to-high- 30s due to ASP pressure and low utilization rates. (S&P)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM | 1 Comment
  • CALX

    Crushed this year due to weak U.S. service provider capex, Calix (CALX +15.9%) has taken off...

    Crushed this year due to weak U.S. service provider capex, Calix (CALX +15.9%) has taken off after beating lowered estimates and guiding on its earnings call for Q4 revenue (excludes the Ericsson deal) of $87M and EPS of $0.05, nearly even with a consensus of $87M and $0.06. Calix and Acme Packet's results are lifting telecom equipment peers, many of whom sold off earlier this week: ADTN +1.9%. CIEN +3.8%. JNPR +2.5%. SONS +3.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM
  • OI

    Owens-Illinois (OI -2.5%) trades lower today, ignoring an early morning upgrade to Buy on...

    Owens-Illinois (OI -2.5%) trades lower today, ignoring an early morning upgrade to Buy on valuation at BofA/Merrill Lynch. The firm says headwinds for the company have diminished and most of the negative news and earnings revisions appear behind it. Management also appears more attuned to capital returns and free cash flow generation, which warrants an expansion in valuation multiples.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:39 PM
  • CTCT

    Constant Contact (CTCT -25.6%) is having an awful day after delivering its Q3 report, and is...

    Constant Contact (CTCT -25.6%) is having an awful day after delivering its Q3 report, and is taking down online marketing software peers in the process. MKTG -3.2%. ELOQ -1.6%. ET-OLD -2.5%. BV-OLD -1.7%. While results weren't bad, Q4 guidance for revenue of $65.2M-$65.5M and EPS of $0.14-$0.16 fell short of a consensus of $67.5M and $0.18. During its earnings call, CTCT blamed a failure to convert trial users of its e-mail marketing software, and said it's making sales changes in response.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:19 PM | 1 Comment
  • AAPL

    Apple (AAPL -2.6%) is now seeing a decent post-earnings selloff. Aside from the margin issues,...

    Apple (AAPL -2.6%) is now seeing a decent post-earnings selloff. Aside from the margin issues, the Street is likely concerned about Apple's relatively soft European and Asia-Pac performance. Europe and China's macro problems are one reason, but in light of Samsung's Q3 smartphone sales and recent market share data (I, II), Android competition could be another. U.S. and Japanese sales grew much faster thanks to iPhone share gains - could the Japanese gains finally lead to a deal with NTT DoCoMo? (more) (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM | 45 Comments
  • ATGE

    Midday top 10 gainers: DV +25%. AMCC +24%. RCON +21%. TASR +18%. NEU +17%. STMP +16%. VAR +16%....

    Midday top 10 gainers: DV +25%. AMCC +24%. RCON +21%. TASR +18%. NEU +17%. STMP +16%. VAR +16%. ELMD +14%. N +14%. TSYS +15%. Midday top 10 Losers: CBRX -42%. CTCT -26%. MXWL -23%. HMSY -21%. VRSN -19%. REDF -16%. DECK -18%. UQM -17%. IPCM -16%. BJRI -15%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • VAR

    Varian Medical Systems (VAR +15.4%) pops after beating on its FQ4 result late yesterday. Net...

    Varian Medical Systems (VAR +15.4%) pops after beating on its FQ4 result late yesterday. Net earnings jumped 19% Y/Y on better oncology systems and X-ray product sales. The company also offered upbeat revenue guidance for the new fiscal year and current quarter. For both 2013 and the first quarter, the company says revenue could increase 8% to 9%. Analysts had projected FY revenue growth of 7% and FQ1 revenue growth of 6% respectively.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:35 PM
  • QLIK

    Qlik (QLIK -14.1%) has fallen to 2-year lows in the wake of its Q3 miss. Though Q4 revenue...

    Qlik (QLIK -14.1%) has fallen to 2-year lows in the wake of its Q3 miss. Though Q4 revenue guidance of $125M-$130M is in-line with a $127.5M consensus, EPS guidance of $0.22-$0.24 is below a $0.29 consensus. During its earnings call, Qlik noted European sales (54% of revenue) were up 10% Y/Y, but added Americas revenue is being pressured by longer sales cycles. Big data peers are lower: TIBX -2.8%. TDC -2.1%. SPLK -3.2%. MSTR -2%. Informatica (INFA -0.9%) is also off, reversing yesterday's post-earnings gains (I, II).

     
     
     
     
    | 12:24 PM
  • MWW

    Shares of Monster Worldwide (MWW -5.6%) continue their volatile ways as the undercurrent of...

    Shares of Monster Worldwide (MWW -5.6%) continue their volatile ways as the undercurrent of whether or not a buyout is on tap stays in the background. Minyanville pushes the M&A chatter aside to talk fundamentals: Is Monster relevant in the jobs posting market with LinkedIn the go-to resume site or is a MySpace vs. Facebook dynamic setting up?
     
     
     
     
    | 12:17 PM
  • ARCH

    It's a good day for coal stocks, as Arch Coal (ACI +9.8%) logged surprise Q3 profit growth...

    It's a good day for coal stocks, as Arch Coal (ACI +9.8%) logged surprise Q3 profit growth instead of expected red ink and Cloud Peak's (CLD +11%) Q3 results beat estimates. ANR +4.2%, JRCC +3.9%. But Cliffs Natural Resources (CLF -3.9%) continues to feel the pain of its dismal Q3; Dahlman Rose cuts shares to Hold on expected low iron ore prices and cash flow concerns.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM | 1 Comment
  • CERN

    Cerner (CERN +12.4%) pops after easily beating Q3 estimates late yesterday. Net profit rose 25%...

    Cerner (CERN +12.4%) pops after easily beating Q3 estimates late yesterday. Net profit rose 25% Y/Y on record sales and the rollout of its new cloud-based services for physicians. Operating margin widened to 22.1% from 21.1%, as operating expenses rose 15%. The company ups its guidance once again, raising the lower end of its FY12 earnings range by two cents to between $2.34 to $2.36 a share. It also raised its revenue forecast, now expecting between $2.63B and $2.66B, up from previous estimates of $2.58B to $2.63B.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:09 PM | 1 Comment
  • QCOM

    Qualcomm (QCOM +1.9%) is trading higher after BMO argues the Q3 results (I, II) of mobile phone...

    Qualcomm (QCOM +1.9%) is trading higher after BMO argues the Q3 results (I, II) of mobile phone OEMs suggest the company's December and March quarter EPS will be well above expectations. Apple's iPhone beat matters more to Qualcomm than its iPad miss - though designed into the 3G/4G iPad, Qualcomm's iPhone exposure is easily higher. FQ4 results arrive on Nov. 7.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM | 1 Comment
  • AAUKY

    Anglo American (OTCPK:AAUKY +3.5%) is upgraded to Buy at BAML as the departure of Cynthia...

    Anglo American (OTCPK:AAUKY +3.5%) is upgraded to Buy at BAML as the departure of Cynthia Carroll as CEO is considered a catalyst for potential changes such as spinning off its platinum business or selling a stake in the Minas Rio mining project in Brazil. But BMO Capital says the decision could be a sign of bad news ahead from Minas Rio, such as further delays or cost increases.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM | 1 Comment
  • EA

    Electronic Arts (EA -2.5%) slips after receiving a downgrade to Sector Perform from Pac Crest....

    Electronic Arts (EA -2.5%) slips after receiving a downgrade to Sector Perform from Pac Crest. Following checks, the firm thinks EA is having a slow year (ed: you could say the same for the whole industry), and has decided to cut estimates below consensus. EA reports on Tuesday.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM
  • MXWL

    Maxwell (MXWL -21.7%) is making multi-year lows following its Q3 report, which was accompanied...

    Maxwell (MXWL -21.7%) is making multi-year lows following its Q3 report, which was accompanied by guidance for Q4 revenue to be similar to Q1's $39.2M - that's far below a consensus of $52.2M. The ultracpacitor vendor blames weak European demand and "application issues" with hybrid bus drive systems. Maxwell also expects revenue to decline Q/Q in Q1 '13 (consensus stands at $46.5M) due to the Chinese New Year. Needham is downgrading shares to Hold. (transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM | 2 Comments
  • JOY

    Shares of Joy Global (JOY +2.4%) are spiking on renewed takeover talk. This time the rumor is...

    Shares of Joy Global (JOY +2.4%) are spiking on renewed takeover talk. This time the rumor is that GE has offered $78 per share for the company. Earlier in the week, William Blair's Larry De Maria commented that a takeout of JOY by GE was highly likely over the medium term.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM | 2 Comments
  • PGRX

    Potash miner Prospect Global Resources (OTC:PGRX -8%) says P-E firm Apollo Global (NYSE:APO)...

    Potash miner Prospect Global Resources (OTC:PGRX -8%) says P-E firm Apollo Global (NYSE:APO) will buy $100M of its debt to help it develop an Arizona mine believed to have the largest potash reserves in the U.S. The deal follows PGRX's 10-year potash supply deal earlier this week with a Chinese fertilizer company, which showed creditors it has customers in place and a guaranteed cash stream.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM
  • APKT

    Acme Packet (APKT +14.4%) makes like the Roadrunner following its Q3 report. In light of Acme's...

    Acme Packet (APKT +14.4%) makes like the Roadrunner following its Q3 report. In light of Acme's recent struggles and those of telecom equipment peers (I, II), the Street is relieved to see Q4 guidance for revenue of $270M-$275M and EPS of $0.43-$0.47 (consensus is for $272.2M and $0.47). The VoIP infrastructure provider noted on its earnings call European service provider demand is "a bright spot," even as North American demand (long a problem) remains weak.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:24 AM
  • BRS

    Shares of helicopter operator Bristow Group (BRS -1.6%) slip after disclosing in an SEC filing...

    Shares of helicopter operator Bristow Group (BRS -1.6%) slip after disclosing in an SEC filing that it has suspended operations with its EC225 Puma helicopters after one operated by another company was forced on Monday to ditch on the North Sea. All 19 passengers survived, but the Civil Aviation Authority ordered companies to refrain from using EC225 Puma helicopters - of which BRS has 16 - until further notice.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM
  • COL

    Rockwell Collins (COL +1.9%) moves up after beating FQ4 EPS estimates this morning. Net profit...

    Rockwell Collins (COL +1.9%) moves up after beating FQ4 EPS estimates this morning. Net profit fell 13% Y/Y however, due to restructuring charges and a slowdown in government systems sales over budget concerns. Sales in the segment - its largest top-line contributor - fell 10% to $701M. Bottom line results were bouyed by cost cutting measures, which gave a boost to operating margins, improving to 23.5% from 20.9%. Additionally, the company says it plans to cut 1,250 jobs through September, or 6% of its workforce.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:09 AM
  • MXIM

    Maxim (MXIM +5.6%) is up strongly after beating FQ1 estimates. FQ2 guidance - revenue of...

    Maxim (MXIM +5.6%) is up strongly after beating FQ1 estimates. FQ2 guidance - revenue of $595M-$625M and EPS of $0.39-$0.43 vs. a consensus of $620.8M and EPS of $0.43 - isn't great, but that's par for the course for chip stocks right now. Maxim could also be getting a lift from top customer Samsung's Q3 report. During its earnings call, Maxim said its smartphone design wins are now complemented by tablet wins for multiple analog product lines.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM
  • STMP

    Shares of Stamps.com (STMP +17.4%) continue to trek higher following the company's Q3 report...

    Shares of Stamps.com (STMP +17.4%) continue to trek higher following the company's Q3 report which showed demand for printable postage is strong. For the full-year, Stamps.com expects EPS to fall in a range of $1.55 to $1.75, up from prior guidance of $1.35-$1.55.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM
  • AMCC

    AppliedMicro (AMCC +26.9%) skies higher following it FQ2 report. Though results were ho-hum, the...

    AppliedMicro (AMCC +26.9%) skies higher following it FQ2 report. Though results were ho-hum, the beaten-down telecom chipmaker guided on its earnings call for FQ3 revenue to rise 8%-12% Q/Q (consensus is for a 7% increase). It also announced a partnership with Red Hat (NYSE:RHT) and ARM (NASDAQ:ARMH) to develop server designs based on AppliedMicro's ARM CPUs. Evercore has added AppliedMicro to its Conviction Buy list, touting the company's backlog, share gains, and declining inventories. Rival PMC-Sierra (PMCS +2.1%) is up a bit.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM | 2 Comments
  • AMZN

    Amazon (AMZN +4.5%) has done a complete about-face after missing Q3 estimates and issuing soft...

    Amazon (AMZN +4.5%) has done a complete about-face after missing Q3 estimates and issuing soft Q4 guidance (I, II). The Street priced in some worries ahead of time, and could be taking kindly to healthy customer account growth and third-party merchant activity. Nomura's Brian Nowak, who has been bullish for a while, is pleased Amazon's gross margin rose 180 bps Y/Y (albeit while falling Q/Q), but is concerned about still-soaring fulfillment expenses. Overstock (OSTK +6.7%) and eBay (EBAY +1.4%) are also up. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM | 46 Comments
  • VRSN

    VeriSign (VRSN -19.1%) opens sharply lower after missing Q3 EPS estimates and guiding on its...

    VeriSign (VRSN -19.1%) opens sharply lower after missing Q3 EPS estimates and guiding on its earnings call for 2012 revenue of $870M-$875M, mostly below an $874.8M consensus. The company mentioned Q3 domain name registry additions fell short of guidance due to search algorithm changes (presumably Google's) changing the "economics" of certain domain names, along with macro headwinds (particularly in Europe).

     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM | 5 Comments
  • CROX

    One-hit wonders? Crocs (CROX -0.1%) and Deckers Outdoor (DECK -17.9%) give investors a painful...

    One-hit wonders? Crocs (CROX -0.1%) and Deckers Outdoor (DECK -17.9%) give investors a painful lesson on how banking on a single product to drive growth in retail can end up in pain for the company, no matter how trend-setting the item may be at the time. Analysts note Under Armour (UA -0.7%) successfully branched out from its original niche, while Crocs and Deckers Outdoor stayed largely tied to their trademark product. 52-week return: Crocs -22.1%, Deckers Outdoor -71.7%, Under Armour +27.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:42 AM
  • WETF

    WisdomTree (NASDAQ:WETF): Q3 EPS of $0.03 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $21.7M (+22% Y/Y) beats by...

    WisdomTree (NASDAQ:WETF): Q3 EPS of $0.03 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $21.7M (+22% Y/Y) beats by $450K. AUM of $16.8B vs. $15B in Q2. Net inflows of $1B vs. $0.2B a year ago. Industry market share of 1.8% vs. 0.9% a year ago. No ETF price wars here (yet) - average fee of 0.54%, unchanged from last quarter. Pre-tax margin of 21% vs. 8% a year ago. Shares +3.2%. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:36 AM
  • CRZO

    Carrizo Oil & Gas (NASDAQ:CRZO) +5% premarket on news the stock will replace Overseas...

    Carrizo Oil & Gas (NASDAQ:CRZO) +5% premarket on news the stock will replace Overseas Shipholding Group (NYSE:OSG) in the S&P SmallCap 600 index after the close of trading on Oct. 29.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:28 AM
  • CA

    CA -6.4% following its FQ2 report. Not only did revenue miss estimates, the company guided for...

    CA -6.4% following its FQ2 report. Not only did revenue miss estimates, the company guided for FY13 (ends March '13) revenue of $4.58B-$4.67B and EPS of $2.36-$2.44, below a consensus of $4.76B and $2.48. FQ2 EPS was propped up by $250M in stock buybacks. Bookings fell 13% Y/Y, and backlog by 7% (North American bookings -25%). CA has faced tough competition from SolarWinds (NYSE:SWI), ServiceNow (NYSE:NOW), and IBM's Tivoli unit. (transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:23 AM
  • EXPE

    Premarket gainers: EXPE +16%. PPC +11%. ACI +10%. GALE +6%. JRCC +6%. LOGI +6%. Losers: CBRX...

    Premarket gainers: EXPE +16%. PPC +11%. ACI +10%. GALE +6%. JRCC +6%. LOGI +6%.
    Losers: CBRX -28%. CTCT -22%. DECK -19%. VRSN -17%. IMOS -15%. SPF -6%. ERIC -5%. CSTR -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • BTU

    Peabody Energy (NYSE:BTU), eager to tap Mongolia's massive coal resources, says it expects to...

    Peabody Energy (NYSE:BTU), eager to tap Mongolia's massive coal resources, says it expects to resume talks with the government in early 2013 over acquiring a stake in the undeveloped western block of the Tavan Tolgoi deposit. BTU was part of a consortium that won a bid last year on a development, but the bid process was rejected by the government after Japan and South Korea cried foul.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:02 AM
  • DECK

    Naturally, analysts are jumping all over Deckers Outdoor (NASDAQ:DECK) with downgrades following...

    Naturally, analysts are jumping all over Deckers Outdoor (NASDAQ:DECK) with downgrades following the retailer's weak Q3 report and outlook. The bullish-leaning Sterne Agree says it will talk to management before revising estimates, but yesterday's sharp cut in Q4 sales guidance from the firm to 6% growth from 19% seems to speak volumes already. DECK -18.7% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:58 AM | 7 Comments
  • SIRI

    Sirius XM Radio (NASDAQ:SIRI) edges up 0.4% premarket after a scare Apple was entering the...

    Sirius XM Radio (NASDAQ:SIRI) edges up 0.4% premarket after a scare Apple was entering the Internet radio scene threw shares off kilter late in the day yesterday. When push comes to shove, the report was a rehash of previous news and Sirius XM Radio is considered by a majority of analysts as well-positioned to meet the challenge.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:46 AM | 1 Comment
  • WLT

    Walter Energy (NYSE:WLT) says Q3 earnings will include a goodwill impairment charge of as much...

    Walter Energy (NYSE:WLT) says Q3 earnings will include a goodwill impairment charge of as much as $1.1B as a result of changes in the global outlook for met coal and recent weakness in worldwide demand. WLT +2.2% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:31 AM | 2 Comments
  • ARCH

    More on Arch Coal's (NYSE:ACI) Q3 results: Shipped 37.5M tons of coal, -6% Y/Y but +19% Q/Q....

    More on Arch Coal's (NYSE:ACI) Q3 results: Shipped 37.5M tons of coal, -6% Y/Y but +19% Q/Q. Believes "global coal markets are in the process of correcting - with the domestic thermal market building some momentum while metallurgical markets are bottoming out." Says it is focusing on improving operational efficiency, optimizing its asset base and preserving liquidity. Shares +11.3% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:26 AM | 5 Comments
  • CMCSA

    More on Comcast (NASDAQ:CMCSA): The company is drawing kudos from analysts for delivering on its...

    More on Comcast (NASDAQ:CMCSA): The company is drawing kudos from analysts for delivering on its promise to break even on the Olympics. Though by the numbers the Olympics may be a wash, it's still paying dividends as NBC shows - heavily promoted during the games - help drive the network to its best ratings start in nine years. Shares +2.0% premarket. (Earnings: I, II)
